title: SYSTEM$SHOW_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRETS | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Returns the client secrets in a string. The client ID and a client secret must be included in the authorization header to the OAuth token endpoint.
Name of the integration. Note that the integration name is case-sensitive and must be uppercase and enclosed in single quotes.
The function returns the following elements in a JSON object:
Secondary client secret for the specified integration. Snowflake supports two client secrets to allow for uninterrupted rotation.
Client secret for the specified integration
The following example retrieves the client secret for the specified integration:
